catalogue_raissonne: Hagiwara Hideo hanga sakuhin mokuroku 2013, no. 195
creditline: Gift of Sue Y.S. Kimm and Seymour Grufferman
description: abstract; blue ground; multicolored triangles, rectangles, blue circle clustered together left of center
inscription: bottom center, in pencil:  Soil (9) 地底の街 Town in the earth | LRC, in pencil: 24/30
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
text: This print is part of a series of over 20 with focus on ‘Soil.’ Since 1959, Hagiwara printed the paper on both sides, thus forcing the pigment through the paper as if he would be dying it. Since this special technique was very laborious and time-consuming, he abandoned it in 1963.
title: Soil (9): Town in the Earth
